posts.post_content: You really can't even call this removal when something as simple as vigilance or defender can completely nullify it. I think it came down to the last minute and R&D forgot to fix this so someone tacked a cantrip on it on the way out the door to the printers.

posts.post_content:
Good one, Wizards.  
I always wanted a cantrip version of that [great blue counterpart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=129521) of [Arrest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arrest).  
This one is probably the best one of them all, for just six mana i can prevent my opponent's creature from untapping, booyah! Now if just that stupid [Sun Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sun Titan) didn't have vigilance...  
*/sarcasm*  
  
(You know, different versions of Dehydration wouldn't even be that annoying if just the cost wouldn't be so incredibly high each time. Yeah, blue is (gladly) not the color for spot removal. But why print cards so bad that just spashing another color for efficient spells will always be a better idea?)

posts.post_content:
Yeah its fun going on gatherer and having a laugh about the crappy cards wizards has made over the years...  
  
...Until you go home, and you have some card with a rating lower then 1 just chilling in your card box. And you know its there, but you just can't do anyhting about it without apeparing crazy. And you're lamenting the day you opened that booster pack/theme deck/card box and have horrific memorites of the time you thought you'd try that card in a deck, just for a laugh, and the memory of drawing it and your soul fleeing your body...  
  
It is then that you feel the chill hand of magic card hell on your soul...

Posted By: Arachobia (10/4/2011 10:01:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Why do people rate cards like this for its uses in constructed formats? **DUH**, *it's meant to be used in limited.* And as a late-pick removal option, it's actually a pretty solid card, since it's in blue, which usually has a harder time finding removal. Does that make it great? Nah. But I certainly wouldn't mind nabbing this as a late pick anytime i was running blue.  
  
3/5 for limited. And I'll be rating it as such, since that's the only time it's relevant (so, haters, get ready to HATE)
